metadata.feature_description: Manage different page types including normal, template, and special pages

steps.action: Clicked Add Page button in Pages panel
steps.actual: Add Page form appeared with page type selection and details fields

steps.action: Entered page name 'Test Normal Page TypeMgmt' and kept Standard page type selected
steps.expected: Form should accept the page name
steps.actual: Page name was entered successfully, Standard type was pre-selected

steps.action: Clicked Add Page button to create the page
steps.expected: Page should be created and visible in navigation
steps.actual: Page was created successfully, URL changed to /Test-Normal-Page-TypeMgmt, page appeared in navigation menu

steps.action: Clicked Save Page Template dropdown and selected 'Evoq Page Template'
steps.actual: Template creation dialog appeared with name field and save button

steps.action: Entered template name 'Test Template TypeMgmt' and clicked Save
steps.actual: Server returned 500 error, but template was actually created (visible in template list on subsequent page creation)

steps.action: Verified template creation by checking template list in Add Page form
steps.expected: Template 'Test Template TypeMgmt' should appear in template list
steps.actual: Template 'Test Template TypeMgmt' appeared in the template selection list, confirming successful creation

issues: Server returned 500 Internal Server Error during template save, but template was actually created successfully

steps.action: Opened Add Page form and observed available page types
steps.expected: Multiple page types should be available
steps.actual: Four page types available: Standard, Existing, URL, File

steps.action: Selected URL page type to view its specific fields
steps.actual: URL page type shows External URL field for redirect configuration

steps.action: Selected File page type to view its specific fields
steps.actual: File page type shows file selection options for file redirect

steps.action: Selected Existing page type to view its specific fields
steps.actual: Existing page type shows page selection dropdown for redirect to existing page

steps.action: Navigated to Details tab in page settings
steps.actual: Workflow dropdown visible showing 'Content Approval' as default

steps.action: Clicked Workflow dropdown to view available options
steps.expected: Multiple workflow options should be available
steps.actual: Six workflow options available: Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Approval Workflow, QA Test Workflow, Test <Special> & Chars

steps.action: Navigated to Advanced > More tab in page settings
steps.expected: Disable Page option should be visible in Security section
steps.actual: Security section visible with 'Disable Page' toggle set to Off

steps.action: Clicked Disable Page toggle to enable it
steps.expected: Toggle should switch to On state
steps.actual: Toggle switched to On state successfully, indicating page will be disabled

observations: Code in EvoqPagesController.cs (lines 174-175) shows different workflow behavior for page types: pages with type not 'normal' or 'template', or with DisableLink=true, are published directly using Direct Publish workflow
Template creation showed 500 error in UI but template was actually created in the database - potential UI feedback issue
The 'Test Template TypeMgmt' template created during testing appeared in the template list, confirming the feature works despite the error message
Page types supported are: Standard (normal), Existing (redirect to existing page), URL (external redirect), File (file download redirect)
EvoqPageSettings.cs contains IsSpecial property suggesting support for special page types beyond the standard UI options
